html:
6.26.18  6:31 pm   6.25.18  7:08 am this is insane. Do you use a multiband compressor ? If not I think you should look into it


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201806250708

6.25.18  7:08 am   6.24.18  7:56 am what are some things you learned while mixing the song

      i micromanaged a record breaking number of eq points on the vocal. normally i only manage 1 point but this time i did 15. i did it in the car, because i was just sick of the volatile eq experience in the car. so pretty much every word is eq'd individually so it doesn't boing out weird in the car. i think there are expensive machines that some how do this automatically but i don't have them
original_html: 6.26.18  6:31 pm   6.25.18  7:08 am this is insane. Do you use a multiband compressor ? If not I think you should look into it

answers_original.html:
6.25.18  7:08 am   6.24.18  7:56 am what are some things you learned while mixing the song

      i micromanaged a record breaking number of eq points on the vocal. normally i only manage 1 point but this time i did 15. i did it in the car, because i was just sick of the volatile eq experience in the car. so pretty much every word is eq'd individually so it doesn't boing out weird in the car. i think there are expensive machines that some how do this automatically but i don't have them

html: 6.26.18  9:57 am   i've never really been interested in making original music even though i listen to music a lot and enjoy playing other artists' songs on piano and ukulele from time to time. i also like singing a lot although i'm not too good of a singer. Sometimes i record those "covers" i make with my phone and listen to them again and again (egoistic??). however, ilve recently liked the idea of original music more. i have an ipad with garageband, a crappy ukulele, and my voice. could this be the start?

html: 6.26.18  9:52 am   it's finally summer vacation and i'm really excited to finally get going on allotting all of my time to 'building an empire,' since all during the school year i have to focus on adhering to someone else's curriculum. yet i'm still anxious because i know when summer ends and i get back to school (i'm going into 11th grade) i'm going to have to start interacting with others again, and i don't know how to be nice and genuine with others while still socially isolating myself to have as much time as possible to get done the stuff i want to get done (i don't want to mislead others into thinking i'm interested in spending more time with them than i do). you seem to live a solitary lifestyle and i'm wondering: how did you handle this when you were in school or at least when you had to be around people on a frequent basis? thanks.
original_html: 6.26.18  9:52 am   it's finally summer vacation and i'm really excited to finally get going on allotting all of my time to 'building an empire,' since all during the school year i have to focus on adhering to someone else's curriculum. yet i'm still anxious because i know when summer ends and i get back to school (i'm going into 11th grade) i'm going to have to start interacting with others again, and i don't know how to be nice and genuine with others while still socially isolating myself to have as much time as possible to get done the stuff i want to get done (i don't want to mislead others into thinking i'm interested in spending more time with them than i do). you seem to live a solitary lifestyle and i'm wondering: how did you handle this when you were in school or at least when you had to be around people on a frequent basis? thanks.
